metadata.title: CVE-2017-14103 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The ReadJNGImage and ReadOneJNGImage functions in coders/png.c inGraphicsMagick 1.3.26 do not properly manage image pointers after certainerror conditions, which allows remote attackers to conduct use-after-freeattacks via a crafted file, related to a ReadMNGImage out-of-orderCloseBlob call. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incompletefix for CVE-2017-11403.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14103` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-8
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-8
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-8
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-8
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-8').
